values.name: Math
values.description: This element is required to wrap all math related elements. It's called math instead of maths because it's designed by americans.

values.name: Row
values.description: A way to group mathematical elements in a row for semantic reasons.

values.name: Operators
values.description: What counts as an operator is quite complicated, but can be used for lots of operators with many options.

values.name: Exponents
values.description: This uses a superscript element to represent exponents

values.name: Fraction
values.description: For representing fractions, when a number can be represented as a ratio of numbers

values.name: Square root
values.description: For representing a square root which is the inverse of the square operation

values.name: Arbitrary root
values.summary: Root/radical for any number, e.g. cube root
values.description: For representing an arbitrary root which is the inverse of the exponent operation
